title: Players going against Pyke should see their execution marker
body:
Riot has dedicated themselves to readability in League. Almost every champion with an execute has some sort of marker that tells enemy players what is going to happen and a chance to do something about it (heal, zhonyas, etc). 

{{champion:238}} - Ult marker changes when it will kill you
{{champion:31}} - A red, toothy, ring will appear at your feet when his ult will kill you
{{champion:86}} - Giant glowing icon to let you know that you are the villain and his attacks will do true damage
{{champion:122}} - Drops of blood and sound effects lets you know when his passive has reached max stacks

Considering that Pyke's ult ignores resistances and shields I think it is important for players to know when they can be killed by it to give them a chance to play a little more safe. 

Also take into account that the execution marker for Pyke can vary greatly game to game and player to player. For me? I build resistances on Pyke, so my ult executes targets at around 10% health..which is very readable. Full AD Pyke builds on the other hand will be able to execute at a much higher health state, and I think enemy players should be able to see this without having to check his build by tabbing or clicking on him.

This might be a little late to the party, but for anyone that still looks at this post:

When Pyke goes into his Ghostwater Dive and your health is below the thresh hold, his normal proximity music will sound much louder and scarier to indicate he can execute you. But this is only when he's in his GhostDive :P so just an fyi
IIRC Zed's mark shows champions that will increase your AD bonus from killing them while ulted, or shows who will give you the most AD from killing them with utl.

There are 2 markers. There is one at ALL times on whoever gives an upgrade to his ult passive. The other is AFTER he ults you there is a horizontal spinning shuriken thingy over their head that signifies your work is done.

Ahm... as Cho'Gath, only he can see the execution mark.

As Zed will appear a shuriken above their head if the damage will do =< current HP.
As Garen (I'm not so sure about this one), only you can see the big glowing sword when your ult will execute. Not saying that only Garen sees the Villian.
As Darius, he doesn't have an execute mark, only a 5-stack mark.
As Urgot, his ult will execute if the target is =< 25% HP, and the mark is (I'm not sure about this one as well) only visible by his teammates.

EDIT: Also Pyke's ult is a skillshot, it can be missed.
And zed's ult requires him to do damage to you AFTER it, Urgots ult requires  a skill shot to land, even Darius's ult can be dodged if you time a flash just right

Zed is a point and click Ult, the final damage amplifies whenever you deal damage to that champion within the next 3~ seconds after you marked.
Urgot can throw away his ult first, the second cast is the one that matters. **IF** you got hit by his ult, you have to be careful dropping to 25% HP because of the second cast, not his first.
Darius' ult is a point and click, simple.
Garens mark is visible to everyone, and grows larger when they are killable by the ult alone, as it is literally the villain mark itself.

I know the mark is visible for everyone, just not sure **if** the glowing sword (Ult will execute) is visible for everyone.
